definition: scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll
variant of 帙[zhi4]/variant of 秩[zhi4]/(classifier) ten years
a huge amount (of books and papers)

sentences.english: At the end, he ground out the enormous "Biography of George Washington".
sentences.chinese: 最后，他苦心经营总算写成卷帙浩繁的《华盛顿传》。

sentences.english: There are many kinds of traditional moral rules in China.
sentences.chinese: 中国传统道德卷帙浩繁，博大精深。

sentences.english: Under the Code, regardless of section, to voluminous and the time.
sentences.chinese: 下编不分章节，以卷帙为次。

definition: a huge amount (of books and papers)
variant of 帙[zhi4]/variant of 秩[zhi4]/(classifier) ten years
twenty four dynastic histories (or 25 or 26 in modern editions)/same as 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
vast as the open sea (idiom); fig. extensive (library)
volumes of classics/volumes of scriptures/ancient scrolls
twenty four dynastic histories (or 25 or 26 in modern editions)
